title: Coşqun Diniyev
text:
Coşqun Diniyev (born on 13 September 1995 in <a href="Baku">Baku</a>, <a href="Azerbaijan">Azerbaijan</a>) is an <a href="Azerbaijani%20people">Azerbaijani</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Midfielder%20%28football%29">midfielder</a> who currently plays for the <a href="Azerbaijan%20Premier%20League">Azerbaijan Premier League</a> side <a href="Zira%20FK">Zira</a>.
Personal life.
Diniyev's father, <a href="%C5%9Eahin%20Diniyev">Şahin Diniyev</a>, is the current manager of <a href="Kapaz%20PFK">Kapaz</a>, for whom his older brother <a href="Karim%20Diniyev">Karim Diniyev</a> also plays for <a href="Sabah%20FC%20%28Azerbaijan%29">Sabah FC</a>.
Club career.
Coşqun Diniyev made his professional debut in the <a href="Azerbaijan%20Premier%20League">Azerbaijan Premier League</a> for <a href="Inter%20Baku%20PIK">Inter Baku</a> on 18 November 2012 in a game against <a href="Turan-Tovuz%20IK">Turan-Tovuz</a>.
On 1 June 2015, Diniyev signed a two-year contract with <a href="Qaraba%C4%9F%20FK">Qarabağ FK</a>.
Diniyev made his debut for <a href="Qaraba%C4%9F%20FK">Qarabağ</a> in a 2–2 away draw against <a href="Gabala%20FK">Gabala</a> on 10 August 2015.
Coşqun Diniyev made his debut for <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20UEFA%20Champions%20League%20group%20stage">UEFA Champions League group stage</a> game against <a href="Chelsea%20F.C.">Chelsea</a> in <a href="Stamford%20Bridge%20%28stadium%29">Stamford Bridge</a> on 12 September 2017.
On 13 January 2019, Diniyev signed a three-year contract with <a href="Sabah%20FK">Sabah FK</a>.
International career.
Diniyev made his <a href="Azerbaijan%20national%20football%20team">Azerbaijan</a> debut on 7 June 2015 against <a href="Serbia%20national%20football%20team">Serbia</a> in <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a>.
Career statistics.
International.
"Statistics accurate as of match played 9 June 2018"
